lines.text: Talking of vagabonds, something must be done about Daniel Dance before the visit.
He's bound to be contemptuous of course. The Irish always are.
There's going to be a revolution. A revolution I tells you.
I suppose one of these days you'll allow yourself to have a bit of fun.
Oh I doubt it - I'm incredibly practical.
You'll end up on a haystack like your grandfather!
Where the blazes is Little Heyhoe?
[the PRO gives the secretary an admiring glance]
[Sally has taken some food to Dan, her grandfather, who is lurking in Sir Digby Montague's garden]
[church bell is tolling continuously in the background]
No money for you today, Daniel Dance, old boy. The Reverend Simpson passed away peaceful in the night.
Passed away? The poor old devil. He'll know now whether he's been wasting his time or not.
[Emma Stebbins walks towards the almshouses, wearing a long hooded cloak and carrying a wicker basket]
Mind you don't meet a big bad wolf!
